gimmick.item: Defenders: Choose 1 or 2 enemies, or create a Clock - PCs cannot target other enemies until they are dealt with.

Waves: Any time a group of enemies is defeated, it is replaced by another enemy group at the end of the round. This occurs condition until a condition is met, or a target is met. The goal is for players to make interesting decisions about when to defeat an enemy or not. Adjust difficulty or allow Rest between rounds.

Reinforcements: At the end of each round, a new enemy appears to replace any that were defeated. This occurs until a condition is met, or a target is met. They should be lower level than usual. The goal is for players to manage enemies while accomplish some other objective that will stop further reinforcements.
Sequence: The PCs must perform actions or damage types in a specific order to defeat an enemy, or disable their most powerful abilities.

Action Immunity: The PCs cannot use a specific action type against an enemy, or the enemy can only be made vulnerable by using a specific Action. This can be used to force players to use different tactics, or to make a specific enemy more difficult.

environment.item: At the end of each round, the environment deals {threats.damage.level} {element} to {target}.
At the end of each round, {target} become {statusEffects}.
At the end of each round, {target} lose {threats.damage.level} MP.
At the end of each round, {target} that performed the {actions} Action takes {threads.damage.level} damage.
Whenever an action deals {element} damage, {target} become {statusEffects}.
Whenever an action deals {element} damage, {target} receive {threats.damage.level} {element} damage.
